top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s gravel roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel Grit 'n Grind isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s mixed gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Gravel Grit 'n Grind rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Grit 'n Grind — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s mixed gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Grit 'n Grind — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed gravel.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Grit 'n Grind. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Grit 'n Grind when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Gravel Grit 'n Grind count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s mixed gravel delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Gravel Grit 'n Grind — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Grit 'n Grind’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Grit 'n Grind requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 50 miles of mixed gravel in Halmstad, Sweden.
